revised_title: Deflagration to Detonation Transition in Solid and Liquid Explosives: A Shock-Pass, Heat-Filter Method
tldr: The authors studied the initiation and growth of explosions in solids and liquids, focusing on the deflagration-to-detonation transition. They used a'shock-pass, heat-filter' method to investigate the phenomenon, presenting preliminary results using various primer and receptor charges. The study showed that the transition from deflagration to detonation can be influenced by factors such as plate thickness and the presence of liquid explosives.
